1-- Summary formatter for coverage reports
2local M = {}
3
4-- Generate a summary coverage report from coverage data
5function M.format_coverage(coverage_data)
6 -- Validate the input data to prevent runtime errors
7 if not coverage_data then
8 print("ERROR [Reporting] Missing coverage data")
9 return {
10 files = {},
11 total_files = 0,
12 covered_files = 0,
13 files_pct = 0,
14 total_lines = 0,
15 covered_lines = 0,
16 lines_pct = 0,
17 total_functions = 0,
18 covered_functions = 0,
19 functions_pct = 0,
20 overall_pct = 0
21 }
22 end
23
24 -- Make sure we have summary data
25 local summary = coverage_data.summary or {
26 total_files = 0,
27 covered_files = 0,
28 total_lines = 0,
29 covered_lines = 0,
30 total_functions = 0,
31 covered_functions = 0,
32 line_coverage_percent = 0,
33 function_coverage_percent = 0,
34 overall_percent = 0
35 }
36
37 -- Debug output for troubleshooting
38 print("DEBUG [Reporting] Formatting coverage data with:")
39 print(" Total files: " .. (summary.total_files or 0))
40 print(" Covered files: " .. (summary.covered_files or 0))
41 print(" Total lines: " .. (summary.total_lines or 0))
42 print(" Covered lines: " .. (summary.covered_lines or 0))
43
44 local report = {
45 files = coverage_data.files or {},
46 total_files = summary.total_files or 0,
47 covered_files = summary.covered_files or 0,
48 files_pct = summary.total_files > 0 and
49 ((summary.covered_files or 0) / summary.total_files * 100) or 0,
50
51 total_lines = summary.total_lines or 0,
52 covered_lines = summary.covered_lines or 0,
53 lines_pct = summary.total_lines > 0 and
54 ((summary.covered_lines or 0) / summary.total_lines * 100) or 0,
55
56 total_functions = summary.total_functions or 0,
57 covered_functions = summary.covered_functions or 0,
58 functions_pct = summary.total_functions > 0 and
59 ((summary.covered_functions or 0) / summary.total_functions * 100) or 0,
60
61 overall_pct = summary.overall_percent or 0,
62 }
63
64 return report
65end
66
67-- Generate a text summary of quality data
68function M.format_quality(quality_data)
69 -- Validate input
70 if not quality_data then
71 print("ERROR [Reporting] Missing quality data")
72 return {
73 level = 0,
74 level_name = "unknown",
75 tests_analyzed = 0,
76 tests_passing = 0,
77 quality_pct = 0,
78 issues = {}
79 }
80 end
81
82 -- Extract useful data for report
83 local report = {
84 level = quality_data.level or 0,
85 level_name = quality_data.level_name or "unknown",
86 tests_analyzed = quality_data.summary and quality_data.summary.tests_analyzed or 0,
87 tests_passing = quality_data.summary and quality_data.summary.tests_passing_quality or 0,
88 quality_pct = quality_data.summary and quality_data.summary.quality_percent or 0,
89 issues = quality_data.summary and quality_data.summary.issues or {}
90 }
91
92 return report
93end
94
95-- Register formatters
96return function(formatters)
97 formatters.coverage.summary = M.format_coverage
98 formatters.quality.summary = M.format_quality
99end
./lib/coverage/static_analyzer.lua
0/840
0/1
0.0%
1--[[
2Static analyzer for coverage module.
3This module parses Lua code using our parser and generates code maps
4that identify executable lines, functions, and code blocks.
5]]
6
7local M = {}
8
9local parser = require("lib.tools.parser")
10local filesystem = require("lib.tools.filesystem")
11
12-- Cache of parsed files to avoid reparsing
13local file_cache = {}
14
15-- Line classification types
16M.LINE_TYPES = {
17 EXECUTABLE = "executable", -- Line contains executable code
18 NON_EXECUTABLE = "non_executable", -- Line is non-executable (comments, whitespace, end keywords, etc.)
19 FUNCTION = "function", -- Line contains a function definition
20 BRANCH = "branch", -- Line contains a branch (if, while, etc.)
21 END_BLOCK = "end_block" -- Line contains an end keyword for a block
22}
23
24-- Module configuration
25local config = {
26 control_flow_keywords_executable = true, -- Default to strict coverage
27 debug = false,
28 verbose = false
29}
30
31-- Helper function for debug logging
32local function log_debug(message)
33 -- Only print if debug is enabled in config
34 if config.debug then
35 print("[Coverage Static Analyzer] " .. message)
36 end
37end
38
39-- Helper for verbose logging (more detailed than debug)
40local function log_verbose(message)
41 -- Only print if verbose is enabled in config
42 if config.verbose then
43 print("[Coverage Static Analyzer Verbose] " .. message)
44 end
45end
46
47-- Initializes the static analyzer
48function M.init(options)
49 options = options or {}
50 file_cache = {}
51
52 -- Update config from options
53 if options.control_flow_keywords_executable ~= nil then
54 config.control_flow_keywords_executable = options.control_flow_keywords_executable
55 end
56
57 -- Propagate debug settings
58 if options.debug ~= nil then
59 config.debug = options.debug
60 end
61
62 if options.verbose ~= nil then
63 config.verbose = options.verbose
64 end
65
66 return M
67end
68
69-- Clear the file cache
70function M.clear_cache()
71 file_cache = {}
72end
73
74-- Parse a Lua file and return its AST with enhanced protection
75function M.parse_file(file_path)
76 -- Check cache first for quick return
77 if file_cache[file_path] then
78 return file_cache[file_path].ast, file_cache[file_path].code_map
79 end
80
81 -- Verify file exists
82 if not filesystem.file_exists(file_path) then
83 return nil, "File not found: " .. file_path
84 end
85
86 -- Skip testing-related files to improve performance
87 if file_path:match("_test%.lua$") or
88 file_path:match("_spec%.lua$") or
89 file_path:match("/tests/") or
90 file_path:match("/test/") or
91 file_path:match("/specs/") or
92 file_path:match("/spec/") then
93 return nil, "Test file excluded from static analysis"
94 end
95
96 -- Skip already known problematic file types
97 if file_path:match("%.min%.lua$") or
98 file_path:match("/vendor/") or
99 file_path:match("/deps/") or
100 file_path:match("/node_modules/") then
101 return nil, "Excluded dependency from static analysis"
102 end
103
104 -- Check file size before parsing - INCREASED the limit to 1MB
105 -- This ensures we can handle reasonable-sized source files
106 local file_size = filesystem.get_file_size(file_path)
107 if file_size and file_size > 1024000 then -- 1MB size limit
108 log_debug("Skipping static analysis for large file: " .. file_path ..
109 " (" .. math.floor(file_size/1024) .. "KB)")
110 return nil, "File too large for analysis: " .. file_path
111 end
112
113 -- Read the file content with protection
114 local content, err
115 local success, result = pcall(function()
116 content, err = filesystem.read_file(file_path)
117 if not content then
118 return nil, "Failed to read file: " .. tostring(err)
119 end
120 return content, nil
121 end)
122
123 if not success then
124 return nil, "Exception reading file: " .. tostring(result)
125 end
126
127 if not content then
128 return nil, err or "Unknown error reading file"
129 end
130
131 -- Skip if content is too large (use smaller limit for safety)
132 if #content > 200000 then -- 200KB content limit - reduced from 500KB
133 log_debug("Skipping static analysis for large content: " .. file_path ..
134 " (" .. math.floor(#content/1024) .. "KB)")
135 return nil, "File content too large for analysis"
136 end
137
138 -- Quick check for deeply nested structures
139 local max_depth = 0
140 local current_depth = 0
141 for i = 1, #content do
142 local c = content:sub(i, i)
143 if c == "{" or c == "(" or c == "[" then
144 current_depth = current_depth + 1
145 if current_depth > max_depth then
146 max_depth = current_depth
147 end
148 elseif c == "}" or c == ")" or c == "]" then
149 current_depth = math.max(0, current_depth - 1)
150 end
151 end
152
153 -- Skip files with excessively deep nesting
154 if max_depth > 100 then
155 log_debug("Skipping static analysis for deeply nested file: " .. file_path ..
156 " (depth " .. max_depth .. ")")
157 return nil, "File has too deeply nested structures"
158 end
159
160 -- Finally parse the content with all our protections in place
161 return M.parse_content(content, file_path)
162end
163
164-- Count lines in the content
165local function count_lines(content)
166 local count = 1
167 for _ in content:gmatch("\n") do
168 count = count + 1
169 end
170 return count
171end
172
173-- Create efficient line mappings once instead of repeatedly traversing content
174local line_position_cache = {}
175
176-- Pre-process content into line mappings for O(1) lookups
177local function build_line_mappings(content)
178 -- Check if we've already processed this content
179 local content_hash = tostring(#content) -- Use content length as simple hash
180 if line_position_cache[content_hash] then
181 return line_position_cache[content_hash]
182 end
183
184 -- Build the mappings in one pass
185 local mappings = {
186 line_starts = {1}, -- First line always starts at position 1
187 line_ends = {},
188 pos_to_line = {} -- LUT for faster position to line lookups
189 }
190
191 -- Process the content in one pass
192 local line_count = 1
193 for i = 1, #content do
194 -- Create a sparse position-to-line lookup table (every 100 chars)
195 if i % 100 == 0 then
196 mappings.pos_to_line[i] = line_count
197 end
198
199 if content:sub(i, i) == "\n" then
200 -- Record end of current line
201 mappings.line_ends[line_count] = i - 1 -- Exclude the newline
202
203 -- Record start of next line
204 line_count = line_count + 1
205 mappings.line_starts[line_count] = i + 1
206 end
207 end
208
209 -- Handle the last line
210 if not mappings.line_ends[line_count] then
211 mappings.line_ends[line_count] = #content
212 end
213
214 -- Store in cache
215 line_position_cache[content_hash] = mappings
216 return mappings
217end
218
219-- Get the line number for a position in the content - using cached mappings
220local function get_line_for_position(content, pos)
221 -- Build mappings if needed
222 local mappings = build_line_mappings(content)
223
224 -- Use pos_to_line LUT for quick estimation
225 local start_line = 1
226 for check_pos, line in pairs(mappings.pos_to_line) do
227 if check_pos <= pos then
228 start_line = line
229 else
230 break
231 end
232 end
233
234 -- Linear search only from the estimated line
235 for line = start_line, #mappings.line_starts do
236 local line_start = mappings.line_starts[line]
237 local line_end = mappings.line_ends[line] or #content
238
239 if line_start <= pos and pos <= line_end + 1 then
240 return line
241 elseif line_start > pos then
242 -- We've gone past the position, return the previous line
243 return line - 1
244 end
245 end
246
247 -- Fallback
248 return #mappings.line_starts
249end
250
251-- Get the start position of a line in the content - O(1) using cached mappings
252local function getLineStartPos(content, line_num)
253 -- Build mappings if needed
254 local mappings = build_line_mappings(content)
255
256 -- Direct lookup
257 return mappings.line_starts[line_num] or (#content + 1)
258end
259
260-- Get the end position of a line in the content - O(1) using cached mappings
261local function getLineEndPos(content, line_num)
262 -- Build mappings if needed
263 local mappings = build_line_mappings(content)
264
265 -- Direct lookup
266 return mappings.line_ends[line_num] or #content
267end
268
269-- Create lookup tables for tag checking (much faster than iterating arrays)
270local EXECUTABLE_TAGS = {
271 Call = true, Invoke = true, Set = true, Local = true, Return = true,
272 If = true, While = true, Repeat = true, Fornum = true, Forin = true,
273 Break = true, Goto = true
274}
275
276local NON_EXECUTABLE_TAGS = {
277 Block = true, Label = true, NameList = true, VarList = true, ExpList = true,
278 Table = true, Pair = true, Id = true, String = true, Number = true,
279 Boolean = true, Nil = true, Dots = true
280}
281
282-- Determine if a line is executable based on AST nodes that intersect with it
283-- With optimized lookup tables and time limit
284local function is_line_executable(nodes, line_num, content)
285 -- First check if this is a control flow keyword that should be executable
286 if config.control_flow_keywords_executable and content then
287 local line = content:match("[^\n]*", line_num) or ""
288 local line_text = line:match("^%s*(.-)%s*$") or ""
289
290 -- Check if this line matches a control flow keyword pattern
291 for _, pattern in ipairs({
292 "^%s*end%s*$", -- Standalone end keyword
293 "^%s*end[,%)]", -- End followed by comma or closing parenthesis
294 "^%s*end.*%-%-%s+", -- End followed by comment
295 "^%s*else%s*$", -- Standalone else keyword
296 "^%s*until%s", -- until lines (the condition is executable, not the keyword)
297 "^%s*[%]}]%s*$", -- Closing brackets/braces
298 "^%s*then%s*$", -- Standalone then keyword
299 "^%s*do%s*$", -- Standalone do keyword
300 "^%s*repeat%s*$", -- Standalone repeat keyword
301 "^%s*elseif%s*$" -- Standalone elseif keyword
302 }) do
303 if line_text:match(pattern) then
304 -- This is a control flow keyword and config says they're executable
305 return true
306 end
307 end
308 end
309
310 -- Add time limit protection
311 local start_time = os.clock()
312 local MAX_ANALYSIS_TIME = 0.5 -- 500ms max for this function
313 local node_count = 0
314 local MAX_NODES = 10000 -- Maximum number of nodes to process
315
316 for _, node in ipairs(nodes) do
317 -- Check processing limits
318 node_count = node_count + 1
319 if node_count > MAX_NODES then
320 log_debug("Node limit reached in is_line_executable")
321 return false
322 end
323
324 if node_count % 1000 == 0 and os.clock() - start_time > MAX_ANALYSIS_TIME then
325 log_debug("Time limit reached in is_line_executable")
326 return false
327 end
328
329 -- Skip nodes without position info
330 if not node.pos or not node.end_pos then
331 goto continue
332 end
333
334 -- Fast lookups using tables instead of loops
335 local is_executable = EXECUTABLE_TAGS[node.tag] or false
336 local is_non_executable = NON_EXECUTABLE_TAGS[node.tag] or false
337
338 -- Skip explicit non-executable nodes
339 if is_non_executable and not is_executable then
340 goto continue
341 end
342
343 -- Function definitions are special - they're executable at the definition line
344 if node.tag == "Function" then
345 local node_start_line = get_line_for_position(content, node.pos)
346 if node_start_line == line_num then
347 return true
348 end
349 goto continue
350 end
351
352 -- Function declarations (local function name() or function name()) are executable
353 if node.tag == "Localrec" or node.tag == "Set" then
354 local node_start_line = get_line_for_position(content, node.pos)
355 if node_start_line == line_num then
356 -- Check if this is a function assignment
357 if node[2] and node[2].tag == "Function" then
358 return true
359 end
360 end
361 end
362
363 -- Check if this node spans the line
364 local node_start_line = get_line_for_position(content, node.pos)
365 local node_end_line = get_line_for_position(content, node.end_pos)
366
367 if node_start_line <= line_num and node_end_line >= line_num then
368 return true
369 end
370
371 ::continue::
372 end
373
374 return false
375end
376
377-- Parse Lua code and return its AST with improved timeout protection
378function M.parse_content(content, file_path)
379 -- Use cache if available
380 if file_path and file_cache[file_path] then
381 return file_cache[file_path].ast, file_cache[file_path].code_map
382 end
383
384 -- Safety limit for content size
385 if #content > 600000 then -- 600KB limit (increased from 300KB)
386 return nil, "Content too large for parse_content: " .. (#content/1024) .. "KB"
387 end
388
389 -- Start timing
390 local start_time = os.clock()
391 local MAX_PARSE_TIME = 60.0 -- 60 second total parse time limit (increased from 1 second)
392
393 -- Run parsing with protection
394 local ast, err
395 local success, result = pcall(function()
396 ast, err = parser.parse(content, file_path or "inline")
397
398 if os.clock() - start_time > MAX_PARSE_TIME then
399 return nil, "Parse time limit exceeded"
400 end
401
402 if not ast then
403 return nil, "Parse error: " .. (err or "unknown error")
404 end
405
406 return ast, nil
407 end)
408
409 -- Handle errors from pcall
410 if not success then
411 return nil, "Parser exception: " .. tostring(result)
412 end
413
414 -- Handle errors from parse
415 if not ast then
416 return nil, err or "Unknown parse error"
417 end
418
419 -- Generate code map from the AST with time limit
420 local code_map
421 success, result = pcall(function()
422 -- Check time again before code map generation
423 if os.clock() - start_time > MAX_PARSE_TIME then
424 return nil, "Code map time limit exceeded"
425 end
426
427 code_map = M.generate_code_map(ast, content)
428 return code_map, nil
429 end)
430
431 -- Handle errors from code map generation
432 if not success then
433 return nil, "Code map exception: " .. tostring(result)
434 end
435
436 if not code_map then
437 return nil, result or "Code map generation failed"
438 end
439
440 -- Cache the results if we have a path
441 if file_path then
442 file_cache[file_path] = {
443 ast = ast,
444 code_map = code_map
445 }
446 end
447
448 return ast, code_map
449end
450
451-- Collect all AST nodes in a table with optimization to avoid deep recursion
452local function collect_nodes(ast, nodes)
453 nodes = nodes or {}
454 local to_process = {ast}
455 local processed = 0
456
457 while #to_process > 0 do
458 local current = table.remove(to_process)
459 processed = processed + 1
460
461 if type(current) == "table" then
462 if current.tag then
463 table.insert(nodes, current)
464 end
465
466 -- Add numerical children to processing queue
467 for k, v in pairs(current) do
468 if type(k) == "number" then
469 table.insert(to_process, v)
470 end
471 end
472 end
473
474 -- Performance safety - if we've processed too many nodes, break
475 if processed > 100000 then
476 log_debug("Node collection limit reached (100,000 nodes)")
477 break
478 end
479 end
480
481 return nodes
482end
483
484-- Find all function definitions in the AST using non-recursive approach
485local function find_functions(ast, functions, context)
486 functions = functions or {}
487 context = context or {}
488
489 local to_process = {ast}
490 local processed = 0
491
492 while #to_process > 0 do
493 local current = table.remove(to_process)
494 processed = processed + 1
495
496 if type(current) == "table" then
497 -- Special handling for function definitions with name extraction
498 if current.tag == "Set" and #current >= 2 and current[1].tag == "VarList" and current[2].tag == "ExpList" then
499 -- Check if the right side contains function definition(s)
500 for i, expr in ipairs(current[2]) do
501 if expr.tag == "Function" then
502 -- Get function name from the left side
503 if current[1][i] and current[1][i].tag == "Id" then
504 expr.name = current[1][i][1]
505 elseif current[1][i] and current[1][i].tag == "Index" then
506 -- Handle module.function or table.key style
507 if current[1][i][1].tag == "Id" and current[1][i][2].tag == "String" then
508 expr.name = current[1][i][1][1] .. "." .. current[1][i][2][1]
509 end
510 end
511 table.insert(functions, expr)
512 end
513 end
514 elseif current.tag == "Localrec" and #current >= 2 and current[1].tag == "Id" and current[2].tag == "Function" then
515 -- Handle local function definition
516 current[2].name = current[1][1] -- Copy the name to the function
517 table.insert(functions, current[2])
518 elseif current.tag == "Function" then
519 -- Standalone function (e.g., anonymous, or already part of a larger structure)
520 table.insert(functions, current)
521 end
522
523 -- Add numerical children to processing queue
524 for k, v in pairs(current) do
525 if type(k) == "number" then
526 table.insert(to_process, v)
527 end
528 end
529 end
530
531 -- Performance safety - if we've processed too many nodes, break
532 if processed > 100000 then
533 log_debug("Function finding limit reached (100,000 nodes)")
534 break
535 end
536 end
537
538 return functions
539end
540
541-- Define branch node tags for block detection
542local BRANCH_TAGS = {
543 If = true, -- if statements
544 While = true, -- while loops
545 Repeat = true, -- repeat-until loops
546 Fornum = true, -- for i=1,10 loops
547 Forin = true -- for k,v in pairs() loops
548}
549
550-- Tags that indicate code blocks
551local BLOCK_TAGS = {
552 Block = true, -- explicit blocks
553 Function = true, -- function bodies
554 If = true, -- if blocks
555 While = true, -- while blocks
556 Repeat = true, -- repeat blocks
557 Fornum = true, -- for blocks
558 Forin = true, -- for-in blocks
559}
560
561-- Tags that represent conditional expressions
562local CONDITION_TAGS = {
563 Op = true, -- Binary operators (like and/or)
564 Not = true, -- Not operator
565 Call = true, -- Function calls that return booleans
566 Compare = true, -- Comparison operators
567 Nil = true, -- Nil values in conditions
568 Boolean = true, -- Boolean literals
569}
570
571-- Extract conditional expressions from a node
572local function extract_conditions(node, conditions, content, parent_id)
573 conditions = conditions or {}
574 local condition_id_counter = 0
575
576 -- Process node if it's a conditional operation
577 if node and node.tag and CONDITION_TAGS[node.tag] then
578 if node.pos and node.end_pos then
579 condition_id_counter = condition_id_counter + 1
580 local condition_id = node.tag .. "_condition_" .. condition_id_counter
581 local start_line = get_line_for_position(content, node.pos)
582 local end_line = get_line_for_position(content, node.end_pos)
583
584 -- Only add if it's a valid range
585 if start_line < end_line then
586 table.insert(conditions, {
587 id = condition_id,
588 type = node.tag,
589 start_line = start_line,
590 end_line = end_line,
591 parent_id = parent_id,
592 executed = false,
593 executed_true = false,
594 executed_false = false
595 })
596 end
597 end
598
599 -- For binary operations, add the left and right sides as separate conditions
600 if node.tag == "Op" and node[1] and node[2] then
601 extract_conditions(node[1], conditions, content, parent_id)
602 extract_conditions(node[2], conditions, content, parent_id)
603 end
604
605 -- For Not operations, add the operand as a separate condition
606 if node.tag == "Not" and node[1] then
607 extract_conditions(node[1], conditions, content, parent_id)
608 end
609 end
610
611 return conditions
612end
613
614-- Find all blocks in the AST
615local function find_blocks(ast, blocks, content, parent_id)
616 blocks = blocks or {}
617 parent_id = parent_id or "root"
618
619 -- Process the AST using the same iterative approach as in collect_nodes
620 local to_process = {{node = ast, parent_id = parent_id}}
621 local processed = 0
622 local block_id_counter = 0
623
624 while #to_process > 0 do
625 local current = table.remove(to_process)
626 local node = current.node
627 local parent = current.parent_id
628
629 processed = processed + 1
630
631 -- Safety limit
632 if processed > 100000 then
633 log_debug("Block finding limit reached (100,000 nodes)")
634 break
635 end
636
637 if type(node) == "table" and node.tag then
638 -- Handle different block types
639 if BLOCK_TAGS[node.tag] then
640 -- This is a block node, create a block for it
641 block_id_counter = block_id_counter + 1
642 local block_id = node.tag .. "_" .. block_id_counter
643
644 -- Get block position
645 if node.pos and node.end_pos then
646 local start_line = get_line_for_position(content, node.pos)
647 local end_line = get_line_for_position(content, node.end_pos)
648
649 -- Skip invalid blocks (where start_line equals end_line)
650 if start_line < end_line then
651 -- Create block entry
652 local block = {
653 id = block_id,
654 type = node.tag,
655 start_line = start_line,
656 end_line = end_line,
657 parent_id = parent,
658 branches = {},
659 executed = false
660 }
661
662 -- If it's a branch condition, add special handling
663 if BRANCH_TAGS[node.tag] then
664 -- For If nodes, we want to handle the branches
665 if node.tag == "If" and node[2] and node[3] then
666 -- Node structure: If[condition, then_block, else_block]
667 -- Get conditional expression position
668 if node[1] and node[1].pos and node[1].end_pos then
669 block_id_counter = block_id_counter + 1
670 local cond_id = "condition_" .. block_id_counter
671 local cond_start = get_line_for_position(content, node[1].pos)
672 local cond_end = get_line_for_position(content, node[1].end_pos)
673
674 -- Only add if it's a valid range
675 if cond_start < cond_end then
676 table.insert(blocks, {
677 id = cond_id,
678 type = "condition",
679 start_line = cond_start,
680 end_line = cond_end,
681 parent_id = block_id,
682 executed = false
683 })
684
685 table.insert(block.branches, cond_id)
686 end
687 end
688
689 -- Create sub-blocks for then and else parts
690 if node[2].pos and node[2].end_pos then
691 block_id_counter = block_id_counter + 1
692 local then_id = "then_" .. block_id_counter
693 local then_start = get_line_for_position(content, node[2].pos)
694 local then_end = get_line_for_position(content, node[2].end_pos)
695
696 -- Only add if it's a valid range
697 if then_start < then_end then
698 table.insert(blocks, {
699 id = then_id,
700 type = "then_block",
701 start_line = then_start,
702 end_line = then_end,
703 parent_id = block_id,
704 executed = false
705 })
706
707 table.insert(block.branches, then_id)
708 end
709 end
710
711 if node[3].pos and node[3].end_pos then
712 block_id_counter = block_id_counter + 1
713 local else_id = "else_" .. block_id_counter
714 local else_start = get_line_for_position(content, node[3].pos)
715 local else_end = get_line_for_position(content, node[3].end_pos)
716
717 -- Only add if it's a valid range
718 if else_start < else_end then
719 table.insert(blocks, {
720 id = else_id,
721 type = "else_block",
722 start_line = else_start,
723 end_line = else_end,
724 parent_id = block_id,
725 executed = false
726 })
727
728 table.insert(block.branches, else_id)
729 end
730 end
731 elseif node.tag == "While" and node[1] and node[2] then
732 -- Add condition for while loops
733 if node[1].pos and node[1].end_pos then
734 block_id_counter = block_id_counter + 1
735 local cond_id = "while_condition_" .. block_id_counter
736 local cond_start = get_line_for_position(content, node[1].pos)
737 local cond_end = get_line_for_position(content, node[1].end_pos)
738
739 -- Only add if it's a valid range
740 if cond_start < cond_end then
741 table.insert(blocks, {
742 id = cond_id,
743 type = "while_condition",
744 start_line = cond_start,
745 end_line = cond_end,
746 parent_id = block_id,
747 executed = false
748 })
749
750 table.insert(block.branches, cond_id)
751 end
752 end
753
754 -- Add body for while loops
755 if node[2].pos and node[2].end_pos then
756 block_id_counter = block_id_counter + 1
757 local body_id = "while_body_" .. block_id_counter
758 local body_start = get_line_for_position(content, node[2].pos)
759 local body_end = get_line_for_position(content, node[2].end_pos)
760
761 -- Only add if it's a valid range
762 if body_start < body_end then
763 table.insert(blocks, {
764 id = body_id,
765 type = "while_body",
766 start_line = body_start,
767 end_line = body_end,
768 parent_id = block_id,
769 executed = false
770 })
771
772 table.insert(block.branches, body_id)
773 end
774 end
775 end
776 end
777
778 -- Add the block to our list
779 table.insert(blocks, block)
780
781 -- Process child nodes with this block as the parent
782 for k, v in pairs(node) do
783 if type(k) == "number" then
784 table.insert(to_process, {node = v, parent_id = block_id})
785 end
786 end
787 end
788 end
789 else
790 -- Not a block node, just process children
791 for k, v in pairs(node) do
792 if type(k) == "number" then
793 table.insert(to_process, {node = v, parent_id = parent})
794 end
795 end
796 end
797 end
798 end
799
800 return blocks
801end
802
803-- Find all conditional expressions in the AST
804local function find_conditions(ast, conditions, content)
805 conditions = conditions or {}
806
807 -- Process the AST using the same iterative approach as in collect_nodes
808 local to_process = {{node = ast, parent_id = "root"}}
809 local processed = 0
810 local condition_id_counter = 0
811
812 while #to_process > 0 do
813 local current = table.remove(to_process)
814 local node = current.node
815 local parent = current.parent_id
816
817 processed = processed + 1
818
819 -- Safety limit
820 if processed > 100000 then
821 log_debug("Condition finding limit reached (100,000 nodes)")
822 break
823 end
824
825 -- For branch nodes, extract conditional expressions
826 if type(node) == "table" and node.tag then
827 if BRANCH_TAGS[node.tag] then
828 -- Extract conditions from branch conditions
829 if node.tag == "If" and node[1] then
830 -- If condition
831 if node[1].pos and node[1].end_pos then
832 condition_id_counter = condition_id_counter + 1
833 local cond_id = "if_condition_" .. condition_id_counter
834 local cond_start = get_line_for_position(content, node[1].pos)
835 local cond_end = get_line_for_position(content, node[1].end_pos)
836
837 if cond_start < cond_end then
838 table.insert(conditions, {
839 id = cond_id,
840 type = "if_condition",
841 start_line = cond_start,
842 end_line = cond_end,
843 parent_id = parent,
844 executed = false,
845 executed_true = false, -- Condition evaluated to true
846 executed_false = false -- Condition evaluated to false
847 })
848
849 -- Extract sub-conditions recursively
850 local sub_conditions = extract_conditions(node[1], {}, content, cond_id)
851 for _, sub_cond in ipairs(sub_conditions) do
852 table.insert(conditions, sub_cond)
853 end
854 end
855 end
856 elseif node.tag == "While" and node[1] then
857 -- While condition
858 if node[1].pos and node[1].end_pos then
859 condition_id_counter = condition_id_counter + 1
860 local cond_id = "while_condition_" .. condition_id_counter
861 local cond_start = get_line_for_position(content, node[1].pos)
862 local cond_end = get_line_for_position(content, node[1].end_pos)
863
864 if cond_start < cond_end then
865 table.insert(conditions, {
866 id = cond_id,
867 type = "while_condition",
868 start_line = cond_start,
869 end_line = cond_end,
870 parent_id = parent,
871 executed = false,
872 executed_true = false,
873 executed_false = false
874 })
875
876 -- Extract sub-conditions recursively
877 local sub_conditions = extract_conditions(node[1], {}, content, cond_id)
878 for _, sub_cond in ipairs(sub_conditions) do
879 table.insert(conditions, sub_cond)
880 end
881 end
882 end
883 end
884 end
885
886 -- Process child nodes
887 for k, v in pairs(node) do
888 if type(k) == "number" then
889 table.insert(to_process, {node = v, parent_id = parent})
890 end
891 end
892 end
893 end
894
895 return conditions
896end
897
898-- Generate a code map from the AST and content with timing protection
899function M.generate_code_map(ast, content)
900 -- Start timing with reasonable timeout
901 local start_time = os.clock()
902 local MAX_CODEMAP_TIME = 120.0 -- 120 second time limit for code map generation
903
904 local code_map = {
905 lines = {}, -- Information about each line
906 functions = {}, -- Function definitions with line ranges
907 branches = {}, -- Branch points (if/else, loops)
908 blocks = {}, -- Code blocks for block-based coverage
909 conditions = {}, -- Conditional expressions for condition coverage
910 line_count = count_lines(content)
911 }
912
913 -- Set a reasonable upper limit for line count to prevent DOS
914 if code_map.line_count > 10000 then
915 log_debug("File too large for code mapping: " .. code_map.line_count .. " lines")
916 return nil
917 end
918
919 -- Collect all nodes with time check
920 local all_nodes
921 local success, result = pcall(function()
922 all_nodes = collect_nodes(ast)
923
924 -- Check for timeout
925 if os.clock() - start_time > MAX_CODEMAP_TIME then
926 return nil, "Node collection timeout"
927 end
928
929 return all_nodes, nil
930 end)
931
932 if not success then
933 log_debug("ERROR in collect_nodes: " .. tostring(result))
934 return nil
935 end
936
937 if not all_nodes then
938 log_debug("ERROR: " .. (result or "Node collection failed"))
939 return nil
940 end
941
942 -- Add size limit for node collection
943 if #all_nodes > 50000 then
944 log_debug("AST too complex for analysis: " .. #all_nodes .. " nodes")
945 return nil
946 end
947
948 -- Collect all functions with time check
949 local functions
950 success, result = pcall(function()
951 functions = find_functions(ast)
952
953 -- Check for timeout
954 if os.clock() - start_time > MAX_CODEMAP_TIME then
955 return nil, "Function finding timeout"
956 end
957
958 return functions, nil
959 end)
960
961 if not success then
962 log_debug("ERROR in find_functions: " .. tostring(result))
963 return nil
964 end
965
966 if not functions then
967 log_debug("ERROR: " .. (result or "Function finding failed"))
968 return nil
969 end
970
971 -- Collect all code blocks with time check
972 local blocks
973 success, result = pcall(function()
974 blocks = find_blocks(ast, nil, content)
975
976 -- Check for timeout
977 if os.clock() - start_time > MAX_CODEMAP_TIME then
978 return nil, "Block finding timeout"
979 end
980
981 return blocks, nil
982 end)
983
984 if not success then
985 log_debug("ERROR in find_blocks: " .. tostring(result))
986 return nil
987 end
988
989 if blocks then
990 code_map.blocks = blocks
991 end
992
993 -- Collect all conditional expressions with time check
994 local conditions
995 success, result = pcall(function()
996 conditions = find_conditions(ast, nil, content)
997
998 -- Check for timeout
999 if os.clock() - start_time > MAX_CODEMAP_TIME then
1000 return nil, "Condition finding timeout"
1001 end
1002
1003 return conditions, nil
1004 end)
1005
1006 if not success then
1007 log_debug("ERROR in find_conditions: " .. tostring(result))
1008 -- Don't return, we can still continue without conditions
1009 elseif conditions then
1010 code_map.conditions = conditions
1011 end
1012
1013 -- Create function map with time checks
1014 for i, func in ipairs(functions) do
1015 -- Periodic time checks
1016 if i % 100 == 0 and os.clock() - start_time > MAX_CODEMAP_TIME then
1017 log_debug("Function map timeout after " .. i .. " functions")
1018 break
1019 end
1020
1021 local func_start_line = get_line_for_position(content, func.pos)
1022 local func_end_line = get_line_for_position(content, func.end_pos)
1023
1024 -- Get function parameters
1025 local params = {}
1026 if func[1] and type(func[1]) == "table" then
1027 for _, param in ipairs(func[1]) do
1028 if param.tag == "Id" then
1029 table.insert(params, param[1])
1030 elseif param.tag == "Dots" then
1031 table.insert(params, "...")
1032 end
1033 end
1034 end
1035
1036 -- Extract function name (if available)
1037 local func_name = func.name
1038
1039 -- If no explicit name, check for function declaration patterns
1040 if not func_name then
1041 -- We can use a simpler approach here for performance
1042 func_name = "anonymous_" .. func_start_line
1043 end
1044
1045 table.insert(code_map.functions, {
1046 start_line = func_start_line,
1047 end_line = func_end_line,
1048 name = func_name,
1049 params = params
1050 })
1051 end
1052
1053 -- Completely optimized line analysis - faster and more reliable
1054 -- Rather than trying to analyze each line in detail which is causing timeouts,
1055 -- we'll use a much simpler approach with fewer computations
1056
1057 -- First, determine number of lines to process - increased from 500 to 5000
1058 local MAX_LINES = 5000 -- Higher limit for real files
1059 local line_count = math.min(code_map.line_count, MAX_LINES)
1060
1061 -- Pre-allocate executable lines lookup table
1062 code_map._executable_lines_lookup = {}
1063
1064 -- Pre-process the content into lines all at once
1065 -- This is MUCH faster than calling getLineStartPos/getLineEndPos repeatedly
1066 local lines = {}
1067 if content then
1068 -- Split content into lines (fast one-pass approach)
1069 local line_start = 1
1070 for i = 1, #content do
1071 local c = content:sub(i, i)
1072 if c == '\n' then
1073 table.insert(lines, content:sub(line_start, i-1))
1074 line_start = i + 1
1075 end
1076 end
1077 -- Add the last line if any
1078 if line_start <= #content then
1079 table.insert(lines, content:sub(line_start))
1080 end
1081 end
1082
1083 -- Pre-process nodes once to create a node-to-line mapping
1084 -- This is much faster than checking each node for each line
1085 -- Use a smarter approach for large files
1086 local lines_with_nodes = {}
1087
1088 -- We'll build the mapping differently based on file size
1089 if #all_nodes < 5000 and line_count < 2000 then
1090 -- For smaller files, use comprehensive mapping
1091 -- Process all nodes once
1092 for _, node in ipairs(all_nodes) do
1093 if node and node.pos and node.end_pos then
1094 local node_start_line = get_line_for_position(content, node.pos)
1095 local node_end_line = get_line_for_position(content, node.end_pos)
1096
1097 -- For smaller spans, add to each line
1098 if node_end_line - node_start_line < 10 then
1099 -- Add node to all lines it spans
1100 for line_num = node_start_line, math.min(node_end_line, line_count) do
1101 if not lines_with_nodes[line_num] then
1102 lines_with_nodes[line_num] = {}
1103 end
1104 table.insert(lines_with_nodes[line_num], node)
1105 end
1106 else
1107 -- For larger spans, just mark start and end lines
1108 -- Start line
1109 if not lines_with_nodes[node_start_line] then
1110 lines_with_nodes[node_start_line] = {}
1111 end
1112 table.insert(lines_with_nodes[node_start_line], node)
1113
1114 -- End line
1115 if not lines_with_nodes[node_end_line] then
1116 lines_with_nodes[node_end_line] = {}
1117 end
1118 table.insert(lines_with_nodes[node_end_line], node)
1119 end
1120 end
1121 end
1122 else
1123 -- For larger files, use a more efficient node mapping strategy
1124 -- First, find executable nodes
1125 local executable_nodes = {}
1126 for _, node in ipairs(all_nodes) do
1127 if node and node.pos and node.end_pos and EXECUTABLE_TAGS[node.tag] then
1128 table.insert(executable_nodes, node)
1129 end
1130 end
1131
1132 -- Then map only executable nodes to their start lines
1133 for _, node in ipairs(executable_nodes) do
1134 local node_start_line = get_line_for_position(content, node.pos)
1135 if not lines_with_nodes[node_start_line] then
1136 lines_with_nodes[node_start_line] = {}
1137 end
1138 table.insert(lines_with_nodes[node_start_line], node)
1139 end
1140 end
1141
1142 -- Process lines in larger batches for better performance
1143 local BATCH_SIZE = 250 -- Larger batch size to reduce the number of timeout checks
1144 local executable_count = 0
1145 local non_executable_count = 0
1146
1147 for batch_start = 1, line_count, BATCH_SIZE do
1148 -- Check time only once per batch
1149 if os.clock() - start_time > MAX_CODEMAP_TIME then
1150 break
1151 end
1152
1153 local batch_end = math.min(batch_start + BATCH_SIZE - 1, line_count)
1154
1155 for line_num = batch_start, batch_end do
1156 -- Get the line text
1157 local line_text = lines[line_num] or ""
1158
1159 -- Default to non-executable
1160 local is_exec = false
1161 local line_type = M.LINE_TYPES.NON_EXECUTABLE
1162
1163 -- Initialize multiline comment tracking if needed
1164 if not code_map._in_multiline_comment then
1165 code_map._in_multiline_comment = false
1166 end
1167
1168 -- First check if we're in a multiline comment or this line starts/ends one
1169 local is_comment_line = false
1170
1171 -- Check for multiline comment markers
1172 local comment_start = line_text and line_text:match("^%s*%-%-%[%[")
1173 local comment_end = line_text and line_text:match("%]%]")
1174
1175 -- Determine if this line is part of a multiline comment
1176 if comment_start and not comment_end then
1177 -- Start of multiline comment
1178 code_map._in_multiline_comment = true
1179 is_comment_line = true
1180 elseif comment_end and code_map._in_multiline_comment then
1181 -- End of multiline comment
1182 is_comment_line = true
1183 code_map._in_multiline_comment = false
1184 elseif code_map._in_multiline_comment then
1185 -- Inside multiline comment
1186 is_comment_line = true
1187 end
1188
1189 -- If this is a comment line, mark it non-executable immediately
1190 if is_comment_line then
1191 is_exec = false
1192 line_type = M.LINE_TYPES.NON_EXECUTABLE
1193 -- Otherwise proceed with normal line analysis
1194 elseif line_text and #line_text > 0 then
1195 -- Trim whitespace
1196 line_text = line_text:match("^%s*(.-)%s*$") or ""
1197
1198 -- Always non-executable patterns regardless of config
1199 local always_non_executable_patterns = {
1200 "^%s*%-%-", -- Single-line comments with optional leading whitespace
1201 "^%s*$", -- Blank lines
1202 "^%[%[", -- Start of multi-line string
1203 "^%]%]", -- End of multi-line string
1204 "^.*%[%[.-$", -- Line containing multi-line string start
1205 "^.*%]%]$" -- Line containing multi-line string end
1206 }
1207
1208 -- Control flow keywords patterns - only non-executable if config says so
1209 local control_flow_keywords_patterns = {
1210 "^%s*end%s*$", -- Standalone end keyword
1211 "^%s*end[,%)]", -- End followed by comma or closing parenthesis
1212 "^%s*end.*%-%-%s+", -- End followed by comment
1213 "^%s*else%s*$", -- Standalone else keyword
1214 "^%s*until%s", -- until lines (the condition is executable, not the keyword)
1215 "^%s*[%]}]%s*$", -- Closing brackets/braces
1216 "^%s*then%s*$", -- Standalone then keyword
1217 "^%s*do%s*$", -- Standalone do keyword
1218 "^%s*repeat%s*$", -- Standalone repeat keyword
1219 "^%s*elseif%s*$" -- Standalone elseif keyword
1220 }
1221
1222 -- Start with empty non_executable_patterns
1223 local non_executable_patterns = {}
1224
1225 -- Add always non-executable patterns
1226 for _, pattern in ipairs(always_non_executable_patterns) do
1227 table.insert(non_executable_patterns, pattern)
1228 end
1229
1230 -- Add control flow keywords if config says they're non-executable
1231 if not config.control_flow_keywords_executable then
1232 for _, pattern in ipairs(control_flow_keywords_patterns) do
1233 table.insert(non_executable_patterns, pattern)
1234 end
1235 end
1236
1237 -- Check for non-executable patterns
1238 local is_non_executable = false
1239 for _, pattern in ipairs(non_executable_patterns) do
1240 if line_text:match(pattern) then
1241 is_exec = false
1242 line_type = M.LINE_TYPES.NON_EXECUTABLE
1243 is_non_executable = true
1244 break
1245 end
1246 end
1247
1248 -- If control flow keywords are executable, check if this is a control flow keyword
1249 -- and override is_non_executable if needed
1250 if is_non_executable and config.control_flow_keywords_executable then
1251 for _, pattern in ipairs(control_flow_keywords_patterns) do
1252 if line_text:match(pattern) then
1253 is_exec = true
1254 line_type = M.LINE_TYPES.EXECUTABLE
1255 is_non_executable = false
1256 break
1257 end
1258 end
1259 end
1260
1261 if not is_non_executable then
1262 -- Check for branch-related keywords that should be marked as branch points
1263 local branch_patterns = {
1264 "^%s*if%s", -- If statements
1265 "^%s*elseif%s", -- Elseif statements
1266 "^%s*while%s", -- While loops
1267 "^%s*for%s", -- For loops
1268 "^%s*repeat%s" -- Repeat-until loops
1269 }
1270
1271 local is_branch = false
1272 for _, pattern in ipairs(branch_patterns) do
1273 if line_text:match(pattern) then
1274 is_exec = true
1275 line_type = M.LINE_TYPES.BRANCH
1276 is_branch = true
1277 break
1278 end
1279 end
1280
1281 if not is_branch then
1282 -- Check for function definitions (which should be marked as functions)
1283 if line_text:match("function") then
1284 is_exec = true
1285 line_type = M.LINE_TYPES.FUNCTION
1286 else
1287 -- Check for other executable patterns
1288 local executable_patterns = {
1289 "=", -- Assignments
1290 "return", -- Return statements
1291 "local%s", -- Local variables
1292 "[%w_]+%(", -- Function calls
1293 "%:%w+%(", -- Method calls
1294 "break", -- Break statements
1295 "goto%s", -- Goto statements
1296 "%{", -- Table creation
1297 "%[", -- Table access or creation
1298 "%+%=", -- Compound operators
1299 "%-%=",
1300 "%*%=",
1301 "%/%="
1302 }
1303
1304 for _, pattern in ipairs(executable_patterns) do
1305 if line_text:match(pattern) then
1306 is_exec = true
1307 line_type = M.LINE_TYPES.EXECUTABLE
1308 break
1309 end
1310 end
1311 end
1312 end
1313 end
1314 else
1315 -- Empty lines are explicitly non-executable
1316 is_exec = false
1317 line_type = M.LINE_TYPES.NON_EXECUTABLE
1318 end
1319
1320 -- For small files, check the pre-computed node mapping as well
1321 if not is_exec and lines_with_nodes[line_num] then
1322 -- Check if any node at this line is executable
1323 for _, node in ipairs(lines_with_nodes[line_num]) do
1324 if EXECUTABLE_TAGS[node.tag] then
1325 is_exec = true
1326 line_type = M.LINE_TYPES.EXECUTABLE
1327 break
1328 end
1329
1330 -- Special case for function definition nodes
1331 if node.tag == "Function" then
1332 -- Only mark the start line as a function
1333 local node_start_line = get_line_for_position(content, node.pos)
1334 if node_start_line == line_num then
1335 is_exec = true
1336 line_type = M.LINE_TYPES.FUNCTION
1337 break
1338 end
1339 end
1340 end
1341 end
1342
1343 -- Store the result
1344 code_map.lines[line_num] = {
1345 line = line_num,
1346 executable = is_exec,
1347 type = line_type
1348 }
1349
1350 -- Also store in fast lookup table
1351 code_map._executable_lines_lookup[line_num] = is_exec
1352
1353 -- Track counts for debugging
1354 if is_exec then
1355 executable_count = executable_count + 1
1356 else
1357 non_executable_count = non_executable_count + 1
1358 end
1359 end
1360 end
1361
1362 -- Final time check and report with file info
1363 local total_time = os.clock() - start_time
1364
1365 -- Always print detailed information for debugging
1366 local file_info = ""
1367 if file_path then
1368 file_info = " for " .. file_path
1369 end
1370
1371 log_verbose(string.format("Code map generation took %.2f seconds%s (%d lines, %d nodes)",
1372 total_time,
1373 file_info,
1374 code_map.line_count or 0,
1375 #all_nodes or 0))
1376
1377 -- Verify we have executable lines
1378 if executable_count == 0 then
1379 log_debug("No executable lines found in file! This will cause incorrect coverage reporting.")
1380
1381 -- Apply emergency fallback for important coverage module files
1382 if file_path and (file_path:match("lib/coverage/init.lua") or file_path:match("lib/coverage/debug_hook.lua")) then
1383 log_debug("FALLBACK: Applying emergency fallback for critical file: " .. file_path)
1384
1385 -- If content is available, quickly classify lines based on simple patterns
1386 if content and type(content) == "string" then
1387 local lines = {}
1388 for line in (content .. "\n"):gmatch("([^\r\n]*)[\r\n]") do
1389 table.insert(lines, line)
1390 end
1391
1392 local fallback_executable = 0
1393
1394 for i, line in ipairs(lines) do
1395 -- Skip empty lines and comment lines
1396 if line:match("^%s*$") or line:match("^%s*%-%-") or line:match("^%s*%-%-%[%[") then
1397 code_map.lines[i] = {
1398 line = i,
1399 executable = false,
1400 type = M.LINE_TYPES.NON_EXECUTABLE
1401 }
1402 code_map._executable_lines_lookup[i] = false
1403 else
1404 -- Mark most other lines as executable
1405 code_map.lines[i] = {
1406 line = i,
1407 executable = true,
1408 type = M.LINE_TYPES.EXECUTABLE
1409 }
1410 code_map._executable_lines_lookup[i] = true
1411 fallback_executable = fallback_executable + 1
1412 end
1413 end
1414
1415 log_debug(string.format("FALLBACK: Marked %d lines as executable with fallback mechanism", fallback_executable))
1416 executable_count = fallback_executable
1417 end
1418 end
1419 end
1420
1421 return code_map
1422end
1423
1424-- Get the executable lines from a code map
1425function M.get_executable_lines(code_map)
1426 if not code_map or not code_map.lines then
1427 return {}
1428 end
1429
1430 local executable_lines = {}
1431
1432 for line_num, line_info in pairs(code_map.lines) do
1433 if line_info.executable then
1434 executable_lines[line_num] = true -- Use hash table for O(1) lookups
1435 end
1436 end
1437
1438 return executable_lines
1439end
1440
1441-- Helper function to get or create a code map from an AST
1442function M.get_code_map_for_ast(ast, file_path)
1443 if not ast then
1444 return nil, "AST is nil"
1445 end
1446
1447 -- If the AST already has an attached code map, use it
1448 if ast._code_map then
1449 return ast._code_map
1450 end
1451
1452 -- Get the file content
1453 local content
1454 if file_path then
1455 content = filesystem.read_file(file_path)
1456 if not content then
1457 return nil, "Could not read file: " .. file_path
1458 end
1459 else
1460 return nil, "No file path provided for code map generation"
1461 end
1462
1463 -- Generate the code map with time limit
1464 local start_time = os.clock()
1465 local MAX_TIME = 1.0 -- 1 second limit
1466
1467 -- Use protected call for map generation
1468 local success, result = pcall(function()
1469 local code_map = M.generate_code_map(ast, content)
1470
1471 -- Attach the code map to the AST for future reference
1472 if code_map then
1473 ast._code_map = code_map
1474 end
1475
1476 -- Check for timeout
1477 if os.clock() - start_time > MAX_TIME then
1478 return nil, "Timeout generating code map"
1479 end
1480
1481 return code_map
1482 end)
1483
1484 if not success then
1485 return nil, "Error generating code map: " .. tostring(result)
1486 end
1487
1488 -- Check if timeout occurred inside the pcall
1489 if type(result) == "string" then
1490 return nil, result
1491 end
1492
1493 return result
1494end
1495
1496-- Fast lookup table for checking if a line is executable according to the code map
1497function M.is_line_executable(code_map, line_num)
1498 -- Quick safety checks
1499 if not code_map then
1500 return false
1501 end
1502
1503 -- Export config value for external use
1504 M.config = config
1505
1506 -- If the line is already marked executable in lookup table, return true
1507 if code_map._executable_lines_lookup and code_map._executable_lines_lookup[line_num] == true then
1508 return true
1509 end
1510
1511 -- Special check for control flow keywords
1512 if config.control_flow_keywords_executable and code_map.source then
1513 local line_text = code_map.source[line_num] or ""
1514 line_text = line_text:match("^%s*(.-)%s*$") or ""
1515
1516 -- Check if this line matches a control flow keyword pattern
1517 for _, pattern in ipairs({
1518 "^%s*end%s*$", -- Standalone end keyword
1519 "^%s*end[,%)]", -- End followed by comma or closing parenthesis
1520 "^%s*end.*%-%-%s+", -- End followed by comment
1521 "^%s*else%s*$", -- Standalone else keyword
1522 "^%s*until%s", -- until lines (the condition is executable, not the keyword)
1523 "^%s*[%]}]%s*$", -- Closing brackets/braces
1524 "^%s*then%s*$", -- Standalone then keyword
1525 "^%s*do%s*$", -- Standalone do keyword
1526 "^%s*repeat%s*$", -- Standalone repeat keyword
1527 "^%s*elseif%s*$" -- Standalone elseif keyword
1528 }) do
1529 if line_text:match(pattern) then
1530 -- Only check for comment patterns
1531 for _, comment_pattern in ipairs({
1532 "^%s*%-%-", -- Single line comment
1533 "^%s*$", -- Empty line
1534 "^%[%[", -- Start of multi-line string
1535 "^%]%]", -- End of multi-line string
1536 }) do
1537 if line_text:match(comment_pattern) then
1538 return false -- It's a comment or empty line, not executable
1539 end
1540 end
1541 -- This is a control flow keyword and config says they're executable
1542 return true
1543 end
1544 end
1545 end
1546
1547 -- Check if we have a precomputed executable_lines_lookup table
1548 if not code_map._executable_lines_lookup then
1549 -- If code_map.lines is available, create a lookup table for O(1) access
1550 if code_map.lines then
1551 code_map._executable_lines_lookup = {}
1552
1553 -- Build lookup table with a reasonable upper limit
1554 local processed = 0
1555 for ln, line_info in pairs(code_map.lines) do
1556 processed = processed + 1
1557 if processed > 100000 then
1558 -- Too many lines, abort lookup table creation
1559 break
1560 end
1561 code_map._executable_lines_lookup[ln] = line_info.executable or false
1562 end
1563 else
1564 -- If no lines data, create empty lookup
1565 code_map._executable_lines_lookup = {}
1566 end
1567 end
1568
1569 -- Use the lookup table for O(1) access
1570 return code_map._executable_lines_lookup[line_num] or false
1571end
1572
1573-- Return functions defined in the code
1574function M.get_functions(code_map)
1575 return code_map.functions
1576end
1577
1578-- Get blocks defined in the code
1579function M.get_blocks(code_map)
1580 return code_map.blocks or {}
1581end
1582
1583-- Get blocks containing a specific line
1584function M.get_blocks_for_line(code_map, line_num)
1585 if not code_map or not code_map.blocks then
1586 return {}
1587 end
1588
1589 local blocks = {}
1590 for _, block in ipairs(code_map.blocks) do
1591 if block.start_line <= line_num and block.end_line >= line_num then
1592 table.insert(blocks, block)
1593 end
1594 end
1595
1596 return blocks
1597end
1598
1599-- Get conditional expressions defined in the code
1600function M.get_conditions(code_map)
1601 return code_map.conditions or {}
1602end
1603
1604-- Get conditions containing a specific line
1605function M.get_conditions_for_line(code_map, line_num)
1606 if not code_map or not code_map.conditions then
1607 return {}
1608 end
1609
1610 local conditions = {}
1611 for _, condition in ipairs(code_map.conditions) do
1612 if condition.start_line <= line_num and condition.end_line >= line_num then
1613 table.insert(conditions, condition)
1614 end
1615 end
1616
1617 return conditions
1618end
1619
1620-- Calculate condition coverage statistics
1621function M.calculate_condition_coverage(code_map)
1622 if not code_map or not code_map.conditions then
1623 return {
1624 total_conditions = 0,
1625 executed_conditions = 0,
1626 fully_covered_conditions = 0, -- Both true and false outcomes
1627 coverage_percent = 0,
1628 outcome_coverage_percent = 0 -- Percentage of all possible outcomes covered
1629 }
1630 end
1631
1632 local total_conditions = #code_map.conditions
1633 local executed_conditions = 0
1634 local fully_covered_conditions = 0
1635
1636 for _, condition in ipairs(code_map.conditions) do
1637 if condition.executed then
1638 executed_conditions = executed_conditions + 1
1639
1640 if condition.executed_true and condition.executed_false then
1641 fully_covered_conditions = fully_covered_conditions + 1
1642 end
1643 end
1644 end
1645
1646 return {
1647 total_conditions = total_conditions,
1648 executed_conditions = executed_conditions,
1649 fully_covered_conditions = fully_covered_conditions,
1650 coverage_percent = total_conditions > 0 and (executed_conditions / total_conditions * 100) or 0,
1651 outcome_coverage_percent = total_conditions > 0 and (fully_covered_conditions / total_conditions * 100) or 0
1652 }
1653end
1654
1655-- Find a block by ID
1656function M.get_block_by_id(code_map, block_id)
1657 if not code_map or not code_map.blocks then
1658 return nil
1659 end
1660
1661 for _, block in ipairs(code_map.blocks) do
1662 if block.id == block_id then
1663 return block
1664 end
1665 end
1666
1667 return nil
1668end
1669
1670-- Calculate block coverage statistics
1671function M.calculate_block_coverage(code_map)
1672 if not code_map or not code_map.blocks then
1673 return {
1674 total_blocks = 0,
1675 executed_blocks = 0,
1676 coverage_percent = 0
1677 }
1678 end
1679
1680 local total_blocks = #code_map.blocks
1681 local executed_blocks = 0
1682
1683 for _, block in ipairs(code_map.blocks) do
1684 if block.executed then
1685 executed_blocks = executed_blocks + 1
1686 end
1687 end
1688
1689 return {
1690 total_blocks = total_blocks,
1691 executed_blocks = executed_blocks,
1692 coverage_percent = total_blocks > 0 and (executed_blocks / total_blocks * 100) or 0
1693 }
1694end
1695
1696return M
./tests/filesystem_test.lua
0/211
0/1
0.0%
1local lust = require("firmo")
2local fs = require("lib.tools.filesystem")
3local describe, it, expect = lust.describe, lust.it, lust.expect
4
5describe("Filesystem Module", function()
6 local test_dir = "/tmp/firmo-fs-test"
7./firmo.lua
0/1194
0/1
0.0%
1-- firmo v0.7.5 - Enhanced Lua test framework
2-- https://github.com/greggh/firmo
3-- MIT LICENSE
4-- Based on lust by Bjorn Swenson (https://github.com/bjornbytes/lust)
5--
6-- Features:
7-- * BDD-style nested test blocks (describe ... (very long line, trimmed to 1000 chars)
lib/core/version.lua
0/5
0/1
0.0%
1-- Version module for firmo
2-- Single source of truth for the project version
3
4-- This file is used by other components like documentation generators,
5-- package managers, and release scripts to determine the current version.
6
7-- S ... (very long line, trimmed to 1000 chars)
./scripts/version_bump.lua
0/130
0/1
0.0%
1#!/usr/bin/env lua
2-- Version Bump Script
3-- Updates version across all project files
4
5-- Configuration
6local config = {
7 -- Known files that should contain version information
8 version_files = {
9 -- Main source of truth
10 { path = "lua/%s/version.lua", pattern = "M.major = (%d+).-M.minor = (%d+).-M.patch = (%d+)",
11 replacement = function(new_version)
12 local major, minor, patch = new_version:match("(%d+)%.(%d+)%.(%d+)")
13 return string.format("M.major = %s\nM.minor = %s\nM.patch = %s", major, minor, patch)
14 end,
15 complex = true
16 },
17 -- Documentation files
18 { path = "README.md", pattern = "Version: v([%d%.]+)", replacement = "Version: v%s" },
19 { path = "CHANGELOG.md", pattern = "## %[Unreleased%]",
20 replacement = "## [Unreleased]\n\n## [%s] - %s" },
21 -- Optional source files
22 { path = "lua/%s/init.lua", pattern = "version = \"([%d%.]+)\"", replacement = "version = \"%s\"" },
23 { path = "lua/%s.lua", pattern = "version = \"([%d%.]+)\"", replacement = "version = \"%s\"" },
24 -- Package files
25 { path = "%s.rockspec", pattern = "version = \"([%d%.]+)\"", replacement = "version = \"%s\"" },
26 { path = "package.json", pattern = "\"version\": \"([%d%.]+)\"", replacement = "\"version\": \"%s\"" },
27 }
28}
29
30-- Get the project name from the script argument or from the current directory
31local project_name = arg[1]
32if not project_name then
33 local current_dir = io.popen("basename `pwd`"):read("*l")
34 project_name = current_dir:gsub("%-", "_")
35end
36
37-- Get the new version from the command line
38local new_version = arg[2]
39if not new_version then
40 print("Usage: lua version_bump.lua [project_name] <new_version>")
41 print("Example: lua version_bump.lua 1.2.3")
42 os.exit(1)
43end
44
45-- Validate version format
46if not new_version:match("^%d+%.%d+%.%d+$") then
47 print("ERROR: Version must be in the format X.Y.Z (e.g., 1.2.3)")
48 os.exit(1)
49end
50
51-- Get the current date for CHANGELOG updates
52local current_date = os.date("%Y-%m-%d")
53
54-- Function to read a file's content
55local function read_file(path)
56 local file, err = io.open(path, "r")
57 if not file then
58 return nil, err
59 end
60 local content = file:read("*a")
61 file:close()
62 return content
63end
64
65-- Function to write content to a file
66local function write_file(path, content)
67 local file, err = io.open(path, "w")
68 if not file then
69 return false, err
70 end
71 file:write(content)
72 file:close()
73 return true
74end
75
76-- Function to extract version from file using pattern
77local function extract_version(path, pattern)
78 local content, err = read_file(path)
79 if not content then
80 return nil, "Could not read "..path..": "..tostring(err)
81 end
82
83 -- Handle patterns that return multiple captures (like the structured version.lua)
84 local major, minor, patch = content:match(pattern)
85 if major and minor and patch then
86 -- This is a structured version with multiple components
87 return major.."."..minor.."."..patch
88 end
89
90 -- Regular single capture pattern
91 local version = content:match(pattern)
92 return version
93end
94
95-- Format path with project name
96local function format_path(path_template)
97 return path_template:format(project_name)
98end
99
100-- Check if a file exists
101local function file_exists(path)
102 local file = io.open(path, "r")
103 if file then
104 file:close()
105 return true
106 end
107 return false
108end
109
110-- Update the version in a file
111local function update_version(file_config, new_version)
112 local path = format_path(file_config.path)
113
114 if not file_exists(path) then
115 print("⚠️ File not found, skipping: " .. path)
116 return true
117 end
118
119 local content, err = read_file(path)
120 if not content then
121 print("❌ Error reading file: " .. path .. " - " .. tostring(err))
122 return false
123 end
124
125 -- Special handling for CHANGELOG.md
126 if path:match("CHANGELOG.md$") then
127 -- Check if [Unreleased] section exists
128 if not content:match("## %[Unreleased%]") then
129 print("❌ CHANGELOG.md does not have an [Unreleased] section. Please add one.")
130 return false
131 end
132
133 -- Ensure [Unreleased] has content for the new version
134 if content:match("## %[Unreleased%]%s*\n\n## ") then
135 print("⚠️ Warning: [Unreleased] section in CHANGELOG.md appears to be empty.")
136 end
137
138 -- Replace the Unreleased section header to add the new version
139 local new_content = content:gsub(
140 "## %[Unreleased%]",
141 string.format("## [Unreleased]\n\n## [%s] - %s", new_version, current_date)
142 )
143
144 -- Update comparison links at the bottom
145 local old_version = extract_version(path, "## %[([%d%.]+)%]")
146 if old_version then
147 -- Ensure the template URL exists
148 if content:match("%[Unreleased%]: .+/compare/v[%d%.]+%.%.%.HEAD") then
149 -- Update existing comparison links
150 new_content = new_content:gsub(
151 "%[Unreleased%]: (.+)/compare/v[%d%.]+%.%.%.HEAD",
152 string.format("[Unreleased]: %%1/compare/v%s...HEAD", new_version)
153 )
154 new_content = new_content:gsub(
155 "%[" .. old_version .. "%]: .+/compare/v.-%.%.%.v" .. old_version,
156 string.format("[%s]: %%1/compare/v%s...v%s", old_version, old_version:match("^%d+%.%d+%.%d+"), old_version)
157 )
158
159 -- Add new version comparison link
160 new_content = new_content:gsub(
161 "%[Unreleased%]: (.+)/compare/v" .. new_version .. "%.%.%.HEAD",
162 string.format("[Unreleased]: %%1/compare/v%s...HEAD\n[%s]: %%1/compare/v%s...v%s",
163 new_version, new_version, old_version, new_version)
164 )
165 end
166 end
167
168 local success, write_err = write_file(path, new_content)
169 if not success then
170 print("❌ Error writing file: " .. path .. " - " .. tostring(write_err))
171 return false
172 end
173
174 print("✅ Updated version in: " .. path)
175 return true
176 else
177 -- Standard replacement for other files
178 local old_version = extract_version(path, file_config.pattern)
179 if not old_version then
180 print("⚠️ Could not find version pattern in: " .. path)
181 return true -- Not a fatal error
182 end
183
184 local new_content
185 if file_config.complex then
186 -- Use a function-based replacement for complex patterns
187 if type(file_config.replacement) == "function" then
188 -- For structured version files like version.lua
189 local replacement_text = file_config.replacement(new_version)
190 new_content = content:gsub(file_config.pattern, replacement_text)
191 else
192 print("❌ Complex replacement specified but no function provided for: " .. path)
193 return false
194 end
195 else
196 -- Simple string replacement
197 local replacement = string.format(file_config.replacement, new_version)
198 local pattern_escaped = file_config.pattern:gsub("%(", "%%("):gsub("%)", "%%)"):gsub("%%", "%%%%")
199 new_content = content:gsub(pattern_escaped, replacement)
200 end
201
202 if new_content == content then
203 print("⚠️ No changes made to: " .. path)
204 return true
205 end
206
207 local success, write_err = write_file(path, new_content)
208 if not success then
209 print("❌ Error writing file: " .. path .. " - " .. tostring(write_err))
210 return false
211 end
212
213 print("✅ Updated version " .. old_version .. " → " .. new_version .. " in: " .. path)
214 return true
215 end
216end
217
218-- Main function to update all versions
219local function bump_version(new_version)
220 print("Bumping version to: " .. new_version)
221
222 local all_success = true
223
224 -- First, update the canonical version
225 local version_file_config = config.version_files[1]
226 local version_file_path = format_path(version_file_config.path)
227
228 if not file_exists(version_file_path) then
229 print("❌ Canonical version file not found: " .. version_file_path)
230
231 -- Ask if we should create it
232 io.write("Would you like to create it? (y/n): ")
233 local answer = io.read()
234 if answer:lower() == "y" or answer:lower() == "yes" then
235 -- Get the directory path
236 local dir_path = version_file_path:match("(.+)/[^/]+$")
237 if dir_path then
238 os.execute("mkdir -p " .. dir_path)
239 write_file(version_file_path, string.format("return \"%s\"", new_version))
240 print("✅ Created version file: " .. version_file_path)
241 else
242 print("❌ Could not determine directory path for: " .. version_file_path)
243 return false
244 end
245 else
246 return false
247 end
248 end
249
250 -- Update each file
251 for _, file_config in ipairs(config.version_files) do
252 local success = update_version(file_config, new_version)
253 if not success then
254 all_success = false
255 end
256 end
257
258 if all_success then
259 print("\n🎉 Version bumped to " .. new_version .. " successfully!")
260 print("\nRemember to:")
261 print("1. Review the changes, especially in CHANGELOG.md")
262 print("2. Commit the changes: git commit -m \"Release: Version " .. new_version .. "\"")
263 print("3. Create a tag: git tag -a v" .. new_version .. " -m \"Version " .. new_version .. "\"")
264 print("4. Push the changes: git push && git push --tags")
265 return true
266 else
267 print("\n⚠️ Version bump completed with some errors.")
268 return false
269 end
270end
271
272-- Run the version bump
273local success = bump_version(new_version)
274if not success then
275 os.exit(1)
276end
lib/reporting/formatters/lcov.lua
0/51
0/2
0/2
0.0%
1-- LCOV formatter for coverage reports
2local M = {}
3
4-- Generate an LCOV format coverage report (used by many CI tools)
5function M.format_coverage(coverage_data)
6 -- Validate the input data to prevent runtime errors
7 if not coverage_data or not coverage_data.files then
8 return ""
9 end
10
11 local lcov_lines = {}
12
13 -- Process each file
14 for filename, file_data in pairs(coverage_data.files) do
15 -- Add file record
16 table.insert(lcov_lines, "SF:" .. filename)
17
18 -- Add function records (if available)
19 if file_data.functions then
20 local fn_idx = 1
21 for fn_name, is_covered in pairs(file_data.functions) do
22 -- FN:<line>,<function name>
23 table.insert(lcov_lines, "FN:1," .. fn_name) -- Line number not always available
24
25 -- FNDA:<execution count>,<function name>
26 if is_covered then
27 table.insert(lcov_lines, "FNDA:1," .. fn_name)
28 else
29 table.insert(lcov_lines, "FNDA:0," .. fn_name)
30 end
31
32 fn_idx = fn_idx + 1
33 end
34
35 -- FNF:<number of functions found>
36 local fn_count = 0
37 for _ in pairs(file_data.functions) do fn_count = fn_count + 1 end
38 table.insert(lcov_lines, "FNF:" .. fn_count)
39
40 -- FNH:<number of functions hit>
41 local fn_hit = 0
42 for _, is_covered in pairs(file_data.functions) do
43 if is_covered then fn_hit = fn_hit + 1 end
44 end
45 table.insert(lcov_lines, "FNH:" .. fn_hit)
46 end
47
48 -- Add line records
49 if file_data.lines then
50 for line_num, is_covered in pairs(file_data.lines) do
51 if type(line_num) == "number" then
52 -- DA:<line number>,<execution count>[,<checksum>]
53 table.insert(lcov_lines, "DA:" .. line_num .. "," .. (is_covered and "1" or "0"))
54 end
55 end
56
57 -- LF:<number of lines found>
58 local line_count = 0
59 for k, _ in pairs(file_data.lines) do
60 if type(k) == "number" then line_count = line_count + 1 end
61 end
62 table.insert(lcov_lines, "LF:" .. line_count)
63
64 -- LH:<number of lines hit>
65 local line_hit = 0
66 for k, is_covered in pairs(file_data.lines) do
67 if type(k) == "number" and is_covered then line_hit = line_hit + 1 end
68 end
69 table.insert(lcov_lines, "LH:" .. line_hit)
70 end
71
72 -- End of record
73 table.insert(lcov_lines, "end_of_record")
74 end
75
76 return table.concat(lcov_lines, "\n")
77end
78
79-- Register formatter
80return function(formatters)
81 formatters.coverage.lcov = M.format_coverage
82end

2 Enhanced Mock Sequence Returns Example

7local lust = require "firmo"
... (very long line, trimmed to 1000 chars)

3local spy = require("lib.mocking.spy")

5local mock = require("lib.mocking.mock")

7local mocking = {}

lib/reporting/formatters/tap.lua
0/61
0/3
0/2
0.0%
1-- TAP (Test Anything Protocol) formatter
2local M = {}
3
4-- Helper function to format test case result
5local function format_test_case(test_case, test_number)
6 -- Basic TAP test line
7 local line
8
9 if test_case.status == "pass" then
10 line = string.format("ok %d - %s", test_number, test_case.name)
11 elseif test_case.status == "pending" or test_case.status == "skipped" then
12 line = string.format("ok %d - %s # SKIP %s",
13 test_number,
14 test_case.name,
15 test_case.skip_reason or "Not implemented yet")
16 else
17 -- Failed or errored test
18 line = string.format("not ok %d - %s", test_number, test_case.name)
19
20 -- Add diagnostic info if available
21 if test_case.failure or test_case.error then
22 local message = test_case.failure and test_case.failure.message or
23 test_case.error and test_case.error.message or "Test failed"
24
25 local details = test_case.failure and test_case.failure.details or
26 test_case.error and test_case.error.details or ""
27
28 local diag = {
29 " ---",
30 " message: " .. (message or ""),
31 " severity: " .. (test_case.status == "error" and "error" or "fail"),
32 " ..."
33 }
34
35 if details and details ~= "" then
36 diag[3] = " data: |"
37 local detail_lines = {}
38 for line in details:gmatch("([^\n]+)") do
39 table.insert(detail_lines, " " .. line)
40 end
41 table.insert(diag, 3, table.concat(detail_lines, "\n"))
42 end
43
44 -- Append diagnostic lines
45 line = line .. "\n" .. table.concat(diag, "\n")
46 end
47 end
48
49 return line
50end
51
52-- Format test results as TAP (Test Anything Protocol)
53function M.format_results(results_data)
54 -- Validate the input data
55 if not results_data or not results_data.test_cases then
56 return "1..0\n# No tests run"
57 end
58
59 local lines = {}
60
61 -- TAP version header
62 table.insert(lines, "TAP version 13")
63
64 -- Plan line with total number of tests
65 local test_count = #results_data.test_cases
66 table.insert(lines, string.format("1..%d", test_count))
67
68 -- Add test case results
69 for i, test_case in ipairs(results_data.test_cases) do
70 table.insert(lines, format_test_case(test_case, i))
71 end
72
73 -- Add summary line
74 table.insert(lines, string.format("# tests %d", test_count))
75 table.insert(lines, string.format("# pass %d", test_count - (results_data.failures or 0) - (results_data.errors or 0)))
76
77 if results_data.failures and results_data.failures > 0 then
78 table.insert(lines, string.format("# fail %d", results_data.failures))
79 end
80
81 if results_data.errors and results_data.errors > 0 then
82 table.insert(lines, string.format("# error %d", results_data.errors))
83 end
84
85 if results_data.skipped and results_data.skipped > 0 then
86 table.insert(lines, string.format("# skip %d", results_data.skipped))
87 end
88
89 -- Join all lines with newlines
90 return table.concat(lines, "\n")
91end
92
93-- Register formatter
94return function(formatters)
95 formatters.results.tap = M.format_results
96end
./scripts/test_lpeglabel.lua

1-- Test script for lpeglabel integration
2package.path = "/home/gregg/Projects/lua-library/firmo/?.lua;" .. package.path
3
4print("Attempting to load lpeglabel module...")
5local ok, lpeglabel = pcall(function()
6 return require("lib.tools.vendor.lpeglabel")
7./tests/truthy_falsey_test.lua
